member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect
member.summary: Generates an image using the Perlin noise function.

remarks.p: The Turbulence effect computes the sum of one or more octaves of the Perlin noise function. Perlin noise is a pseudo-random function whose value depends on the frequency, position, and seed value. This effect outputs pixel values in premultiplied alpha.
This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Turbulence effect.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TurbulenceEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Tileable
member.summary: Turns stitching on or off. If set, the base frequency is adjusted so the output bitmap can be tiled. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of image to generate. Default value (512, 512).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Seed
member.summary: The seed for the pseudo random generator. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Offset
member.summary: Offsets the coordinates where the turbulence output is generated. Default value (0,0).

remarks.p: The algorithm used to generate the Perlin noise is position dependent, so a different offset results in a different output.
Note: changing the offset does not have the same effect as a translation because the noise function output is infinite and the function will wrap around the tile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Octaves
member.summary: Number of octaves for the noise function. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Noise
member.summary: The turbulence noise mode. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Frequency
member.summary: Base frequencies in the X and Y direction. Units are specified in 1/DIPs. Default value (0.01, 0.01).

remarks.p: A value of 1 for the base frequency results in the Perlin noise completing an entire cycle between two pixels. The ease interpolation for these pixels results in completely random pixels, since there is no correlation between the pixels.
With a value of 0.1 for the base frequency, the Perlin noise function repeats every 10 DIPs. This results in correlation between pixels and the typical turbulence effect is visible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.EffectId

remarks.p: Generic way to query the type of an effect. EffectId is equal to the CLSID_D2D1Turbulence GUID specified in the SDK header d2d1effects.h.
